observation: Ranofex - Crypto Mining Platform  home investment crypto mining ai trading faq support login sign up WELCOME TO RANOFEX “Bull or Bear, we’re still running” about us the ranofex Ranofex is a team who have been working together for several years adapting to the cryptocurrency market as a whole (inc. mining, trading and investing) because we firmly believe cryptocurrency is the future. With the years of experience that we have, the team decided that creating ranofex would be a step into the right direction of making crypto-mining feasible for the public to access without fear and with confidence. 18242 Total Members $ 7,860,480 Total Deposited 10,175,089 Total Withdrawals Fully Registered Registration 3rd June 2021 Launch Date our Plan Your browser does not support the video tag. Phase One: Ranofex formed and launched their website Ranofex.com Phase two: Increased inventory of miners within the company. Begin to establish  miners on global scale and AI Trading Bots to match the volume of users as exponential growth occurs Phase three: RanofexControl: An internal system within the website which allows users to track their active investments in real time, and observe their profits generated per day. how to deposit Sign up for an exchange: Create an account for a leading cryptocurrency exchange application. We recommend Binance Coinbase Purchase cryptocurrency: Deposit FIAT currency into your exchange, and convert this into the cryptocurrency that you will be investing with. We accept the top currencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, USDT and Litecoin. We recommend USDT (TRC20) as they have the lowest network fees. Choose a plan: Choose a suitable plan, go to the ‘Investments’ tab, select ‘Start Mining’ and follow the on-screen instructions during the deposit process. Once the transaction has been confirmed, you will have the funds activated in your account as an active investment. NOTE - If you experience any problems during the deposit process, contact us through our 24/7 live Support chat or email us support@ranofex.com HASH 1 contract 3% Daily, 4 Days Contract Name: HASH 1 Min deposit: $50 Daily payout: Yes Payout: Yes Referral Commission We Provide 3 level commission from every 5 3 1 Disclaimer You are encouraged to perform your own due diligence and research and are solely responsible for your earnings. By investing, you agree that Ranofex are not responsible for funds lost in the transaction process whereby you carry out transactions outside our website ranofex.com. All transactions must be carried out only on our website. Certificate Of Company we accept ‹ ›

thought: The website claims to be a crypto mining platform, which is a common area for scams due to the high interest in cryptocurrency. I see a claim of "3% Daily, 4 Days Contract" which seems unusually high and potentially unsustainable, fitting the characteristic of offering an amount of money that is generally not possible. They also mention encouraging users to do their own research, which could be a way to absolve themselves of responsibility. Next, I should check the hyperlinks on the site to ensure they lead to legitimate and related websites.

The contact information provided is a generic email (support@ranofex.com) and a 24/7 live support chat, which could be legitimate, but without further inquiry, it's hard to determine if it's appropriate for business use. The disclaimer that encourages users to perform their own research and states that the company is not responsible for lost funds is concerning, as it could be a tactic to absolve the company of any responsibility in case of a scam. The next step should be to check the domain registration details to see if there are any red flags there.

thought: The WHOIS information indicates that the domain was recently registered and uses a privacy service to hide the registrant's details. This is a common practice, but it can also be a red flag when combined with other suspicious elements. The domain's recent creation date could be concerning, especially if the site claims to have been in business for several years, as this is inconsistent with the registration date. Next, I should check for any online discussions or reports related to this website to see if others have had experiences or identified it as a scam.

Recording feature is useless as you need always to delete many steps. there are much more, accurate, tools like robot framework + browser library or selenium library. Ranorex is a waste of time. Date of experience: October 05, 2022. Useful.'}, {'url': 'https://www.trustpilot.com/review/ranofex.com', 'content': "Anyone can write a Trustpilot review. Companies can ask for reviews via automatic invitations. thought: The search results seem to include a mix-up with another entity called "Ranorex," which appears to be a legitimate software testing tool unrelated to "ranofex.com." The content provided in these search results does not give us any relevant reviews or information concerning the legitimacy of "ranofex.com." Therefore, these observations do not help in determining if "ranofex.com" is a scam website. I should look for more specific discussions or user experiences regarding "ranofex.com" on social media or forums.

There are no Reddit posts related to "ranofex.com," which might indicate that the site is not well-known or has not been discussed in the Reddit community. This absence of discussion could be insignificant or it might be because the site is too new or not widely used. I should try one last approach and look for any information or discussions about "ranofex.com" on Twitter, as it is a platform where users often share their experiences with websites and potential scams.

There are no Twitter posts related to "ranofex.com," which again suggests that the site is not widely discussed or known. This lack of social media presence can be a red flag, especially for a business that claims to have a significant number of members and transactions. The absence of user discussions or reviews can indicate that the platform may not have a real user base or that users have not felt compelled to share their experiences, which is unusual for investment platforms, especially in the cryptocurrency space where community feedback is common. Given the high promised returns, claims of a significant user base, recent domain registration, use of privacy services to hide owner information, and a lack of online presence or user reviews, I am inclined to classify this website as suspicious. However, to solidify my decision, I will check the website's SSL certificate to make sure it is properly secured, as a lack of proper security can be another red flag for scam websites.

thought: The SSL certificate information shows that the site has a certificate from Let's Encrypt, which is a legitimate certificate authority. The certificate is valid, which means the site has taken basic steps to secure communications. However, this does not necessarily validate the legitimacy of the business operations. Based on the observations from the previous actions, including the high promised returns, recent domain registration, privacy services used to obscure owner details, lack of online presence or user reviews on social media platforms, and the disclaimer that absolves the company from responsibility for lost funds, I am inclined to believe that this website displays several characteristics of a scam. I now know the final answer. The website https://ranofex.com/ is likely a scam.

observation.reason: The website promises unusually high returns has a recent domain registration date uses privacy services to hide owner details lacks an online presence or user reviews and includes a disclaimer that absolves the company from responsibility for lost funds all of which are consistent with the characteristics of a scam website as outlined in the provided list.
